data.body:

Renaming an instance with "Editable children" makes it lose the flag.

data.title: Redeclaration of vars possible / Weird side effects
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 x64 - Godot 2.1 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Hence the following code:

```
func _process(delta):
    # Snap-move the grid to place it centered under the camera.
    var grid_pos = _grid.get_translation()
    print(grid_pos.y)
    var camera_pos = _camera.get_translation()
    var offset = grid_size * max_grid_steps / 2
    var grid_pos = Vector3(camera_pos.x - offset, grid_pos.y, camera_pos.z - offset)
    print(grid_pos.y)
    _grid.set_translation(grid_pos)
```

Note how `grid_pos` is declared in the first line of the function, then simply redeclared 4 lines later. This compiles without an error. The old value is lost then.

But wait, there's more! With some basic testing:

```
    var a = Vector3(0, 0, 0)
    var b = Vector3(2, 2, 2)
    var a = Vector3(b.x, a.y, b.z)
    print(a.y)
```

This will bug out at runtime, complaining `a` is `Nil` when wanting to combine `b` and `a` together.

```
    var a = _grid.get_translation()
    var b = Vector3(2, 2, 2)
    var a = Vector3(b.x, a.y, b.z)
    print(a.y)
```

This does **not** cause an error at runtime. `a` "correctly" becomes 2, 0, 2 (when the grid was at Y=0).

In the context of my above code, it gets even worse: The new value of `grid_pos.y` somehow becomes the Y value of `camera_pos`!

```
func _process(delta):
    # Snap-move the grid to place it centered under the camera.
    var grid_pos = _grid.get_translation() # Grid is at 0,0,0
    print(grid_pos.y) # Prints "0"
    var camera_pos = _camera.get_translation() # Camera is at 0,3,6
    var offset = grid_size * max_grid_steps / 2
    var grid_pos = Vector3(camera_pos.x - offset, grid_pos.y, camera_pos.z - offset)
    print(grid_pos.y) # This funnily prints 3 now, though grid_pos.y was 0 all along!
        # It seems to have taken camera_pos.y's value instead.
    _grid.set_translation(grid_pos)
```

To cut a long story short: Redeclaration should be an error, right? The other things might just be follow-up errors.
I fell over this several times already, getting values I totally do not expect.

Sorry if it has been discussed before and for some reason is allowed now. But the behavior with the Y value doesn't make any sense at all.

This also happens with local variables shadowing more global ones, though that would still be okay (even if it should raise a warning or something).

data.title: Scrolling outside Popup areas makes it disappear
data.body: Mac OSX El Capitan, Godot v2.1.stable.official I have a Button marked as a toggle, to show and hide a Popup. I connected its "togged(bool pressed)" event to a script on the Popup, that uses "hide()" and "show()" to do the actual job. This works as expected, except that if I scroll over the button with my touchpad (aka dragging two fingers on it) or using the scroll wheel on my mouse, the Popup disappears. The debugger says that the Popup loses its visibility. It is not moved around, and using the debugger to make it visible again fixes it until the scroll is done again. The code in the button is not being triggered (the 'unpressed! hiding!' message doesn't show up). I think it is not about the button specifically. Replacing the code with a toggle that depends on a variable and instead using the button's pressed method does nothing to fix it. Also it seems that scrolling over some other areas of the screen hides the popup as well. But my minimal example uses a button to show the popup. The Popup documentation doesn't mention anything about this behavior. It doesn't work the other way either: scrolling doesn't make the popup visible. Checking the "Exclusive mode" option on the Popup inspector seems to fix it as well (scroll won't make the Popup disappear), but at least on my example it prevents pressing the button again without using the enter key (the mouse won't function to press the mouse) which is odd too. [demo_bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/466017/demo_bug.zip) I include the example project. Do note that including a ScrollContainer on the Popup still lets the ScrollContainer to scroll correctly, when scrolling OVER it. It is only when scrolling outside the Popup that this happens [demo_bug_with_scroll.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/466021/demo_bug_with_scroll.zip)

data.title: Text Editor Autocompletion should suggest keywords
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 x64 - Godot Stable 2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When typing code in the GDScript text editor, the autocompletion never suggests keywords such as `if`, `true`, etc. This makes it a little annoying to quickly tab them into the code without fully writing the keyword out. Especially when wanting to insert a line break with Enter right after a `pass`, it inserts another word then.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Begin to type GDScript code. In my example, when tabbing `if` away I got `stepify` instead, and for `pass` I got `PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS` inserted.

data.title: Why engine removes objects from the scene?
data.body: Faced with the strange behavior of the engine: When working with a project, for example, when you change the size of any of the objects of the game, for Godot can change the position of other objects, and in some cases completely remove them from the scene. This problem was seen in Version 2.1. It interferes with work.

TileMap get_local_mouse_pos() doesnt work properly on android
data.body:
**Linux Mint, Windows - Godot version: 2.1**
**Xperia Neo V (Android 4.4.4) and Xperia T3**

**Issue description**:
I have simple scene with following structure:
-TileMap ([board.gd.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/464702/board.gd.zip))
--selection

When I run it on the PC everything works as expected.
On the mobile phone I encounter strange behavior.
State switching seems to work fine since "selection" node blinks every screen touch, but
_put_ball() method is delayed/ random.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create new project. Add TileMap then Sprite. Add attached script to the TileMap.
Run project on android via ADB.

data.title: Change Android float ABI to hard
data.body:
I've done the experiment of compiling the Android export templates with the _hard_ float ABI instead of _soft-fp_. I've written a simple test script and measured:

Current _soft-fp_: 1781 +/- 48 ms
Experimental _hard_: 1796 +/- 53 ms

Pretty surprising for me. I didn't expect a big gain because GDScript is a large bottle neck compared with the floating point calling convention; but a pessimization?

Maybe my test program is not the best one for this task or maybe this has yielded gains in other aspects (render, sound, etc.) and only a real-word example is appropiate for testing.

Or maybe this change just does not improve things at all and should not be merged. However, as long as Godot is built as a whole and the relevant functions are qualified with `JNICALL` it should be safe.

At least I've pushed it for the records in case some day this is considered again so both these notes and the relevant compiler flags, etc. could be grabbed from here.

P. S.: The test program is an empty scene with this code:

```
extends Node2D

func _ready():
    set_process(true)

func _process(delta):
    var start = OS.get_ticks_msec()
    for i in range(0, 1000000):
        i = float(i)
        cos(i) * sqrt(i) + exp(i) / i
    var end = OS.get_ticks_msec()
    print(end - start)
```

data.title: Make popup windows / grid column widths resizable
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 x64 - Godot 2.1 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
So I'm sitting here using one of these huge 2560x1440 monitors at default DPI. Godot runs maximized. Opening the editor settings popup window for example makes it that wide that it starts to become hard to trace back the setting value on the far right to the setting's name on the left.

I tried to resize the window, but it seems to be of fixed width. That's a little annoying. (It even just closes when simply trying to hit the border but missing it thus clicking the main application window, or just scrolling outside of it above the main window, but that's another topic).

On top of that, I cannot resize the columns of the grid showing me those settings (to shrink - or better, even autofit - the setting's name column). I saw it was possible in some older version of Godot, but the headers are gone.

Can it be made possible to show these column headers again or (even better IMHO) make those popup windows resizable?

**Steps to reproduce:**
Buy a monitor which is far too huge, open settings window, enjoy (or not).

Using this nightly build I can generate a valid APK that works perfectly on my mobile phone but when using visual scripting it generates an APK that only shows the Godot loading screen and flashes all the time, doesn't display the project at all, it only shows the flashing loading screen.

Any visual script will cause this problem, same project without the visual script runs just fine.

data.title: AssetLib can't download archives from GitHub Release (error 403)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Any OS, current master branch.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When trying to download an asset hosted using GitHub Release (e.g. https://github.com/Geequlim/godot-themes/releases/download/0.1.0/arc_dark_v0.1.0.zip), the download fails with error 403. Because of this, many users are actually uploading their zips to third party websites or versioning them inside their git repo instead of using the more appropriate GH Release, so we should fix that.

data.title: HTTPClient: support gzip http responses
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

OS X 10.11.6, godot v2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Some web APIs `gzip` all responses by default (no option to change or no control of the server) and I can't find a way in godot to `ungzip` it (which makes the response useless gibberish).

Is this something planned, or a possibility?

data.title: Correct Directory.list_dir_begin() Documentation
data.body:
Change the documentation to reflect that Directory.list_dir_begin() returns true (not false) when a stream could not be initialized. (See, for
example,
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/drivers/windows/dir_access_windows.cpp#L76
)
